Reviews.Title: “A sweet hotel walking distance from Sultanahmet.”
Reviews.Author: Fuzzlaw
Reviews.Content: Quite impressed by this sweet hotel. Very clean, helpful staff, and convenient location (though you will walk up a decent hill to get to the Blue Mosque). Unfortunate that construction across the street blocks lower level views...and they have a very sweet outdoor dog for a neighbor!

Reviews.Title: “Berce”
Reviews.Author: Tatiana T
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, with very clean rooms. Excellent choice!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Berce”
Reviews.Author: AlexMscRU
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the historical center, in 300 meters from Sultanahmet MeydanÄ±. The hotel staff are very friendly and always ready to help as well as other citizens. The hotel has a terrace with a beautiful view of Bosporus and sea of Marmara. Minuses: cleanliness in the bathroom was not always at high level. One electrical socket fell out of the wall.

Reviews.Title: “Punches way above its price for comfort, service, food, location”
Reviews.Author: Gareth J
Reviews.Content: We felt privileged to stay at this wonderful little hotel, and were made to feel welcome by Mehmet Kaya and his colleague at the desk (whose name we sadly forget) and the women who prepared our fabulous breakfast each morning on the rooftop terrace overlooking the city. Mehmet, who worked with carpets for ten years, gave excellent advice on shopping in the bazaars, restaurants, tours, getting around...who needs a guide book when you have Mehmet? Our room was clean and comfortable, with a good bathroom. The hotel is just around the corner from the Blue Mosque. We hope to return soon to Istanbul and cannot imagine staying anywhere else. We are staying in touch on Facebook.

Reviews.Title: “Winter days in Berce Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barbara S
Reviews.Content: We arrived March 1st in the snow, but were very glad to stay in this small hotel which has a good atmosphere and a wonderful breakfast. It was nice and cosy and warm. Very friendly and helpful staff, whilst the location is excellent (around the corner from the Blue Mosque and close to the Sea of Marmara. Andre and Barbara

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: Daniel5000
Reviews.Content: A great find from tripadvisor. My partner and I stayed for a week and had a great visit. Mehmet and the rest of the staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was great and varied, including some great Turkish food. This hotel certainly punches above its weight in value for money, with great rooms at budget prices. Keep up the good work! Only downsides were: patchy hot water in the shower and a lack of alarm clock in the room.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem.”
Reviews.Author: Annelou414
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Berce Hotel for my first trip to Istanbul - a week in February - maybe not the best month for weather, there was a mixture of snow, rain and sunshine, but the Berce was very warm and comfortable and a friendly haven to come back to after a day's sightseeing and walking round the city. The rooms are very clean and have everything you might need. It is quiet, calm and well organised. The breakfast is wonderful - home-made, organic and fresh every morning - such delights as borek, omelettes of various types, a range of breads and cakes, fresh salad, eggs and the most wonderful yoghourt I have ever tasted amongst other things! All prepared by some lovely ladies. On reception are two of the nicest men you would want to meet - Mehmet and Serkan (one for day and one for night). They are so helpful and courteous and always ready to assist in any way. I will certainly return here if they have any availability after all these glowing reports! Who needs stars when you get such genuine hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly recommended hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: rsitch12
Reviews.Content: Everything positive written about this hotel is indeed true. Having visited with my wife and friends for a long weekend, I would not hesitate to return another time to The Berce. Rooms were clean and tidy, and breakfast was great (traditional Turkish - lovely selection). Mehmet and his colleague (did not catch his name) are professional and friendly, and unfailingly willing to help with our queries. The staff are also very friendly, and I just wish that all hotels could have customer service of this level. Not suited if you have walking challenges as there is no lift, but apart from that this is an ideal option for a non-expensive hotel in the Sultanhamet area of Istanbul. I never award five stars for anything, as perfection does not exist - but for the money - this comes close.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, good rooms”
Reviews.Author: bas17
Reviews.Content: berce hotel is located in the quieter area of sultanahmet, close to the blue mosque, hippodrome and aya sophia. the hotel is small, but rooms were of adequate size. Our room had 3 small balconies from which we could see the marmara sea :) Mehmet was very helpful in giving directions. The breakfast on the room terrace was nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, Great location”
Reviews.Author: KMSKent
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short break in Istanbul and chose this hotel based on various Trip Advisor reports and I am glad we did as the hotel is perfect in many respects. We arrived in the early hours (due to snow in Istanbul!) and the taxi driver struggeld to find the hotel which is located in a side street that, at first, appears to be in the middle of nowhere. However, when you get your bearings you will realise it's only a few minutes walk from the Blue Mosque and therefore a great base to explore Istanbul. The bedrooms are immaculate and well appointed and the breakfast, served daily on the rooftop terrace, is more than adequate. In addition to the facilities and location, where this hotel really scores is the personal service provided by Mehmet and his team. Nothing was to much trouble for anyone and when we returned to the hotel after day out on Friday, we found a bottle of wine and fruit basket had been delivered to our room as Mehment had realised from our registration card that it was my birthday! - That's what I call service and sadly it's seen all too infrequently these days. All in all a lovely little hotel and we would certainly return

Reviews.Title: “Good choice, good value”
Reviews.Author: HernanCortez
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights here and would stay again. Room was a good size, well maintained and clean. Wifi worked well. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was varied and good. When you first arrive, you may think you're in a bit of a strange area, however once you get your bearings, you'll find that it's a great location to experience Istanbul. All in all, good value.

Reviews.Title: “Cosiness and warm hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Alexander F
Reviews.Content: We have been in Istanbul in January 2012. This was our first trip in Istanbul, and it's lucky that we chose the Berce Hotel. This small hotel is situated on a quiet street 5 minutes walk from the Blue Mosque. The room was very cosy and well-decorated. Our bed was very comfortable. Breakfast was delicious with a fantastic view. We were very well hosted. Special hearty thanks to Mehmet Kaya; he is one of the most pleasant man we've ever met. My wife and I, we can't imagine a nicer place to stay! Other traveller wrote here:"A home away from home", - we are absolutely agree with it.

Reviews.Title: “an amazing stay in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: Gullivertravels75
Reviews.Content: it has taken me a few months to write this review but better late than never. this hotel is a gem in a treasure city. Everything about our stay in Istanbul was fantastic and this hotel is where it all started. located in a small street just off the Sultanahmet hotspots the room we got was of such good taste, spacious, comfy and with unbelievable views of the Bosphorus. Mehmet and his colleague who run the place were very helpful and gave a very welcoming feel to the place, they sugested tours, places to eat, see and shop, made us happy with their recommendations and chats. Even the owner had sometime for us and we spoke in spanish for a while. I loved the breakfast and the view from there. we were told that this sea view was not to be always expected as a building opposite was taken down giving access to this view. we left Istanbul and Berce after 4 days and 3 nights wishing we had more time and promising to come back once day. Great value for money!!

Reviews.Title: “cosy family-style hotel”
Reviews.Author: YuriaM
Reviews.Content: Warm welcome, excellent and friendly service. Simple, clean, warm room, spacious and comfortable at a reasonable price. Roof-top cosy breakfast room (in the conservatory as it is cold and windy on 24th -27th December). Excellent taxi service to and from Airport and good advice on restaurants and dinner-show. You wake up with the chant from the mosque, have a healthy breakfast in the sun on the terrace, explore the sites and come back for a well-deserved rest. We enjoyed the trip and highly recommend the hotel and the staff.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: agnieszkaczy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located- close to Marmare Sea and historical places. It is a small, seven room hotel with a great roof top breakfast room overlooking the sea. The rooms are clean and comfortable, breakfasts tasty and varied and the staff extremely friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our stay a lot and will be back. Thanks for your hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jessika812
Reviews.Content: This winter (7 dec - 12 dec 2011) we stayed in Hotel Berce where we were welcomed with a broad, generous and friendly smile on a very rainy evening! After a goodnight's rest we enjoyed a very rich and delicious breakfast on the roof terrace with beautiful view, enjoying olives, yoghurt, honey, and other great treats! Apple tea, coffee, juices mmmmm. Everything was of a very fresh quality. And the two ladies who cared for the breakfast were sure to assure a very nice beginning of our day. Mr. Mehmet (sorry if the spelling is not correct) and his colleague are very caring, and also the Elder Owner is a very nice person! They all made sure we had a super time and a super holiday, also giving us great tips as where to enjoy our dinner! We really recommend Hotel Berce, Berce Hotel, Istanbul! Thanks again! And we hope to come again! Jessika and Caroline

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in all aspects”
Reviews.Author: jainsambhav
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for all its good reviews and i am not at all dissapointed. This hotel is perfect in every aspect and to top it all the staff , esp. Mehmet was wonderful,made us feel like home and helped us in planning every min of our stay. His never ending patience and always accomodating attitude made our stay all the more comfortable. The staff here was above and beyond helpful for all our small small needs. Personally i would strongly recommend this hotel even more than a 5star. The location is perfect ,within walking distance from topkapi palace,blue mosque etc. Thanks mehmet.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent rest”
Reviews.Author: Uliana U
Reviews.Content: This pretiest small hotel is situated in Sultanahmet district for a few minute walking from the most historical sites in Istanbul. It was the best location I have knew ever. My room had normal size and very clean and nice decorated. Ah yes, there are small sweet balconies in the each room. My one had two balconies. The bed was very comfortable. This hotel have close and open terrace on the roof wÄ±th a wonderful view on Marmara sea. Breakfast was tasteful and after it I could walking untill afternoon without any problem. Especially I want to notice cheese and olives and also honey. Staff was extremally helpfull and nice, always with smiles. I would wish to stay there again and again. I can recommend this hotel for everybody who needs simple, but comfortable rest. And I grateful to host Mehmet Kaya and his assistants very much. Ã‡ok teÅŸekkÃ¼r ederim, her zaman kutlu olunuz.

Reviews.Title: “feel welcome in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: marie_efferink
Reviews.Content: First you'll get a warm welcome. If you want, the are so kind to bring your luggage to your room. The rooms are very cozy, clean and the beds are well made up. The lunchroom is totally upstrairs, Because of all the windows you can see the bosporus just by drinken your coffee or by eating. That view from upstairs is amazing. In the summer you can also eat oudside on the terras, but i thought it was now a little bit to cold. The breakfast is homemade every morning. And there's a lot of everything so you can thouse what you like. If you have any questions, the staff is more than kind to help you in every way they possibly can. If you need a cab, they will ring it for you and it will be there within minutes, by the end of the day, your room will be cleaned up again. In some words: kind people ready to help any time very clean cozy great view from upstairs where you can eat and drink location is very good I recommend this hotel! hope you like it to, when you've experienced it yourselfs.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T HESITATE :BERCE IS JUST WONDERFUL !!!”
Reviews.Author: kaouther L
Reviews.Content: A well placed hotel, with a good receptionist (MEHMET) who helped us all the time !! The room was very clean, the restaurant with a wonderful view to the MARMARA SEA, in the OLD CITY so you won't need any means of transport to visit the MOSQUEE BLEUE or AYASOFIA ,or TOPKAPI or other ottman or roman monuments. It's just what a tourist needs to visit ISTANBUL. There are also many other extra services that the hotel offers which are worth to pay for, such as going to the HAMMAM, restaurants or when coming back home, going to the airport. Thanks to MEHMET who was very helpful and to come back again at this hotel! The only disadvantage: i woke up everyday very early because of the outside light coming from windows because there aren't eghough drapes.

Reviews.Title: “Personal service, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: carinamc
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the hotel. We picked it because of the great reviews, and they were very well earned. Serkan was always at the front desk to greet us and ask us how our day in Istanbul was if we were coming in or give us tips if we were going out. He even knew our names. he put a lot of effort into making sure the guests had a good stay. The room was very clean and cozy. We especially loved breakfast on the terrace, which was delicious and clearly prepared with a lot of care. It is so close to the major sites, my friends couldn't believe I did such a good job of finding the hotel. But yet it is on a quiet street. At most places in Old City, everyone was trying to cheat us, so it was very important to us to have a hotel we liked so much. We actually had the basement room, and it was not a problem at all. It worked out very well because we were a group of three, so the room was perfect for us since it's a little cheaper due to being in the basement. Earlier in the trip we hated the hotel we stayed at, so it was a great relief to have the opposite experience here, where there wasn't anything we would have wanted to change.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Berce Hotel excellently located for walking to many historical attractions.”
Reviews.Author: lisden
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed Istanbul in mid August 2011 and highly recommend the Berce Hotel where we enjoyed 5 nights in mid August 2011 and one more night in late September . The manager, Mehmet, and staff were so very kind and helpful. The service and attention could not be faulted. Mehmet was a particularly helpful source of information. The location was walking distance to so many of the major attractions around Sultanahmet and the very efficient metro was less than 10 minutes walk. The views of the Sea of Marmara and the Bospherus from the roof top dining area and the excellent breakfast and wonderful views provided a terrific start to each day. We will return to Istanbul as there is so much more to see and do. The Berce Hotel will certainly be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service.”
Reviews.Author: Kurt S
Reviews.Content: We stayed a total of 4 nights here. 1 night on our arrival to Turkey and then the last three nights of our trip after visiting Cappadocia. Mehmet and his staff were very nice and helpful, from booking to the time we left. Breakfast was very good with great views of the Sea of Marmara. The hotel is very clean and well cared for. Mehmet arranged a total of four airport shuttles for us. While they were more expensive than other offers from hotels in the area,don't let that scare you, they were well worth the extra money spent. These shuttles were exclusive. Just the two of us directly to and from the airport. No traipsing around the city picking up other passengers. The hotel is in a great location. Very close to the Blue Mosque and the Sultanahmet Tram stop, (probably a 10 minute walk.) The Arasta Bazaar is a few minutes walk away. If we ever make it back to Istanbul we will certainly stay here. The

Reviews.Title: “Delightful little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DavidandBetsy
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights at the Berce at the end of October and loved it. Our room was very comfortable and clean with a beautiful view of the Sea of Mamara. Breakfast on the roof terrace which is enclosed was a treat every morning - good, healthy food (try the raw honey and Turkish yogurt - yum!) and a chance to talk with the others staying at the hotel. The location is convenient, in easy walking distance of most of the historic sites and of many restaurants. Both Mehmet and Serkan were welcoming, kind and willing to do whatever was asked. Their approach is summed up in what Serkan told us: "you are guests of our hotel and of Turkey and we want you to feel welcomed."

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: RobertAustralia
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for three nights and found the rooms, breakfast and location very very good. Mehmet was the best and is so helpful in helping to book tours, give the best advice and tips on how to get around. Be nice to remember to tip him. Do not use taxis as they cheat most of the time and the trams are easy to use, Mehmet had great advice nowhere to eat as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in the heart of things”
Reviews.Author: KevinfromKent
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here at the end of October. Its position is great - a 10 mins stroll to the Blue mosque, a few minutes more to Aya Sophia and then to Topcapi Palace or 20 mins brisker walk to the Grand Bazar. It's a converted house in a generally quiet back street on the edge of what seems to be becoming quiet a trendy area of boutique hotels, shops and restaurants. The room (104 front first floor) was a good size with well finished en suite - all newly refurbished in the last three years. On the top floor is a small glazed breakfast room opening onto a large rooftop terrace - all with great views of the Marmora Sea and across to Asia. The breakfast is a good buffet selection - the usual fruits, cereals, cold meats and cheeses - plus fresh honeycomb from the owner's brother's hives - and filter coffee and tea. Delicious! Two downsides - with such a central position you are surrounded by Mosques and although the street is quiet you will be woken by the call to prayers at 6.30 every morning - all part of the city's magic I guess! Also the bed mattress was very firm - positively hard. I ended up sleeping on top of the duvet to get a bit more padding. The reception staff - two young men - both spoke good English and were help personified. A great place to stay and very reasonable

Reviews.Title: “Quiet sweet hotel”
Reviews.Author: SandiBsf
Reviews.Content: We were there twice, once coming into Turkey and again for five days to see Istanbul for a total of seven nights in two different rooms. Both were lovely and comfortable. Breakfast on the roof was delightful with views of the Sea of Marmara and the Blue Mosque. Our second room had a view of Sea also, two chairs, a desk and wardrobe---quite spacious for the Sultanamet area. Staff, especially Mehmet, were extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel!”
Reviews.Author: 2fromChicagoIL
Reviews.Content: This small jewel of a hotel is a welcome retreat for the weary traveler. There is a delicious breakfast served in the rooftop glassed in or open air terrace daily. So good! The management is helpful and helpful to guests. The owner is frequently on site for that special touch. The rooms are spacious with a unique quality and have modern bathrooms. Although a bit difficult to find on the winding streets of the area, the hotel is within minutes of all the major attractions and tram, as well as good neighborhood restaurants. I recommend this hotel to fellow travelers looking for a good deal in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel well situated”
Reviews.Author: karl p
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well situated very near mosque blue ( 300 meters) and in the midle of ancient Sultanahmet. We had no surprises with the quality offered, everything was ok. My wife liked a lot the beautiful decoration on our bed when we arrived, terrace offer a view on sea, but the most important is that the staff is so helpful. If i have to go back to Istambul, for sure i will go there.

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: Sherri P
Reviews.Content: The Berce Hotel is a gem. The location in the Sultanahmet area is perfect. It is within walking distance of the Sea of Marmara and the historical area where the Haghia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Hippodrome, Basilica Cistern and Topkapi palace are located. It is also close to the tram. The hotel is clean and comfortable. The staff, particularly, the manager, Mehmet, is friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. Mehmet went out of his way to recommend areas of interest and to take care of all the site seeing arrangements. Each morning there is a delious breakfast of fresh foods and local delicacies served on the rooftop terrace overlooking the sea. The hotel was a delightful find in this busy city. I wll recommend it to friends visiting Istanbul and look forward to staying there again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in ancient Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: dub_Traveler62711
Reviews.Content: My wife and brothers recently returned from Turkey and spend 5 nights at the Berce Hotel in the Sultanahmet District of Istanbul. We were greeted by our host Memhet Kaya who made sure that our stay was very comfortable. He was gracious and the hotel was very comfortable. The location was very close to the historic sites of the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, the Basilica Cistern, The Spice Market, the Grand Bazaar all of which we walked to. The street cars were able to carry us to the post where we cruised the Bosphorus. If we have the good fortune to again visit Istanbul, we will be staying at the Berce Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: northerngirl1234
Reviews.Content: A relaxing oasis in an amazing, exciting but tremendously busy city. Quality accommodation with well informed and helpful staff - especisally Mehmet on reception. Excellent breakfast on roof terrace with spectacular views of Sea of Marmara and the Bosphorus. Pre-dinner drinks on the roof terrace where we were able to supply our own drinks - perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pilla
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on Trip Advisor and there wasn't a single adverse review. Mehmet lived up to all that was said of him (and he got us the best table at both the restaurants he booked for us). He and the owner (who was always around at breakfast on the roof terrace, which has a wonderful view) were extremely attentive and helpful, as were the room staff, who were very friendly and always smiling. The rooms (104 & 105) were spacious, while room 105 had a temporary sea view (when the vacant plot opposite is built upon - which could be months or years away, who knows - the sea view will be gone). Everything was very clean. The hotel was in a good central position for visiting sites such as the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya and Topkapi and it was a wonderful area for pottering around. The only thing which I think it fair to add is that the noise of the train (which appears to stop running between about midnight and 5am) is a little disturbing, but apparently this is scheduled to be made redundant any time now. The other noise which might disturb some is the 5am (or so - it varies) call to prayer from the surrounding mosques, although we find it very evocative.

Reviews.Title: “Small Hotel in a good location for all the major sites in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Sasparilla
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed for 4 nights at the Berce Hotel in Istanbul. We were very pleased with both the service and the location and would recommend this small Hotel to other couples. A very good breakfast was served on the top floor terrace and the wonderful Memet took care of all our questions and bookings for different restaurants - we always were given the best table. Very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: nona m
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel close to the centre,the staff were pleasant,room was a large,no road noise,nothing was a problem,everyone is so helpful, excellent service,we like it,thank you for everything.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: JenniferGermany
Reviews.Content: We couldn't be more pleased with our stay at the Berce Hotel. The staff was friendly, helpful, knowledgable, and accommodating. The rooms are lovely- ours had two small balconies- and the rooftop terrace has views to die for. The owner was there to chat with each morning at breakfast, and he even helped arrange a visit to a Turkish bath for me, including round-trip travel. The breakfast buffet was generous and delicious, and we had afternoon coffee on the terrace, too. We will definitely come back here- it was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: Frady96
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in September 2011. We were traveling with another couple. The staff including the owner could not be more helpful and friendly. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. The breakfast on the roof garden was very good. The location is great and there were many good restaurants within walking distance. Definitely recommend this hotel and if we are ever back in Istanbul will stay at this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Almost too good to share”
Reviews.Author: oldromantic13
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Berce Hotel for five nights in July, and felt we had discovered a secret gem. It is family run and is not big or fancy, but the welcome from the manager/owner and the way he did whatever he could to help us enjoy our stay was unusual in its level of warmth (and I used to review hotels for a job!). The room was small and quirky - two armchairs fitted so neatly into one little ante-room that there was no room for our legs if we chose to sit in them, but the choice of three tiny balconies and views of the sea made up for that. (MInd you, the view of the sea involved looking over a semi-derelict building site, and if anyone builds a house there, the view will be gone!) The Berce is in a quiet side street a five-minute walk away from the main sights of the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia, so you are near the sights but also get the feeling of being in a neighbourhood as well. There is a corner shop nearby where we bought bread and cheese and olives and tomatoes, beer and wine for a mellow picnic. The breakfast at the hotel is simple but honest and good (the standard fare of yoghurt, honey, eggs, bread, olives, tomatoes, sausage and coffee), and served on a roof terrace which gives a view of the sea in one direction and a view of the Blue Mosque in another - that's the kind of view we were paying well over the odds for at fancy restaurants nearby. The Berce was also relatively affordable (by Istanbul standards) and when we compared notes with colleagues staying in other hotels in the city, we had a reassuringly warm feeling that we had fallen on our feet with the Berce. Recommended if you want somewhere small, local, quiet, personal and simply charming.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: Steve R
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights on the way home from a long Central Asian trip. The room was delightful, airy and light. Breakfast on the rooftop terrace is wonderful with a fantastic view. The proprietor was friendly and helpful, and the location is simply outstanding for visiting the old city. The street is quiet at night (actually, quiet all the time as far as I can tell.) I will be returning here.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: StuartDonna
Reviews.Content: The Berce is everything that its excellent reputation suggests. In fact, we hesitate to write this review for fear that this marvelous, friendly, well-appointed, superbly situated, enviably priced hotel will become as expensive as its other, less worthy competitors! My husband and I visited in mid May 2011 for five days and were completely overwhelmed by the beauty of our room, the spectacular view from the rooftop veranda and breakfast room, the rich selection of fresh, wholesome foods available in the breakfast buffet itself, the Berce's easy access to Istanbul's major sites, and the warmth and concern of the owner, YaÅŸar, and his staff, especially Mehmet, who went out of their way on a daily basis to make our stay comfortable and memorable. Indeed, we noticed that several of our co-tenants were repeat guests, testimony that speaks for itself. We can't wait to go back and I can't imagine that we would want to stay anywhere else. We felt very much as if we were in the home of friends, including the resident cat curled up on his customary stairwell perch. The Berce was hands down among the best travel experiences we have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: alice S
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our staying in Berce hotel. Everything was great: great position, great hospitality (the guys at the reception, Mehment and Serkan, are very helpful and they will give you all the information needed), great breakfast with fresh turkish products. The rooms were very clean and well equipped. After our staying in Istanbul, we travelled a lot around Turkey but unfortunately we couldn't found an hotel as good as Berce somewhere else. Strongly raccomended! Alice and Alberto from Italy

Reviews.Title: “Berce hotel has everything i want !! WONDERFUL ..Cherine Singapore !”
Reviews.Author: happin
Reviews.Content: This is my first trip to Istanbul by myself. When i arrived to the hotel i could feel the sense of belonging of this hotel. I really lÃ¬ke the feeling of this hotel.. The room was really cosy and quiet and i could rest very well during my stay . Wish i could stay in this room again :) I was really impressed with mehmet and serkan. They were really kind, sincere and helpful throughout my stay. The roof top terrance was a fastastic place for breakfast ! I really enjoyed the great view of the sea.. I still remember one of the staff was really warm and friendly .He served me with all the delicious foods. I would lÃ¬ke to say THANKS to everyone of them in berce hotel. I'Äºl definitely stay in this hotel again :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Hello037
Reviews.Content: A really lovely hotel, very close to all the sites. The staff were really helpfull. The breakfast was lovely. Eating on the roof top terrace was excellent. The room was really nice and had three balconies, but this was on request.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and service take it to the next level.”
Reviews.Author: JPat97
Reviews.Content: Berce was probably one of the best run places I think Iâ€™ve ever stayed at. The room were large and comfy for the price, nicely laid out, with it being a small guesthouse i was surprised at how good the service and amenities were - also with an excellent location a 5/10 walk to most of the sights some brilliant cafes into the smaller market in Sulthamet and to the metro which will get you into the rest of turkey - without being close to the noise and hustle and bustle as its on a really quite street. The hotel staff couldnâ€™t help you enough - they are basically human equivalents of having a lonely planet guide in the hotel, Mehmet gave us a detailed talk about the city all the trips and places to visit and restaurants he recommended were spot on and he was always helpful and had a nice smile on his face along with the rest of the hotel staff. On a side note the breakfast was amazing - best continental ive ever had. Lots of lovely cheeses, breads, hams, omelettes, fruit veg and honey all really fresh. STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel (but read the details to complete the picture)”
Reviews.Author: nikosgeo
Reviews.Content: This beautiful family small hotel has plenty of advantages. The location (it is in Sultanahmet area, in a rather quiet spot, only 5 mins walk from the metro/tram station and VERY close to all the main sites if you're a first timer in Istanbul). The "welcome factor". You will feel very welcome like you're staying to a friend's house, Mehmet and Serkan are two really polite and helpful guys with sincere interest in you and your whole stay. Free wi fi internet into your room ! Nice LCD TV set with many channels. The air condition works very effectively. Very clean room and bathroom. Breakfast in the terrace with wonderful view. When you're in such a warm feeling you don't care about the little small points that you maybe don't like, but to be fair i have to describe them (because maybe some of them are very important for some people). The shower cabin is a bit small if you're bigger than average (i'm 190cm, 95kg) but not very small, the bed was also a bit short for me - acceptable on the limit. We asked for a double bed but we got the common "two matrresses together" style bed - which is not the same. Also it was a bit hard. The pillows were a bit big and from a material which was not so nice. In general the sleep quality was not bad, but only average. Finally, the breakfast had a limited variety BUT everything was fresh and very tasty. As i mentioned before, the whole warm feeling that you get makes all of those details look not important and therefore i certainly recommend this nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value with comfortable and very clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: ntlchin
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel near the hustle and bustle of sultanahmet square and yet very quiet for a good night sleep. This is unlike other hotels crowded around the square which is so noisy even through the night. The staff are great and will make you feel right at home. Breakfast is great with a fantastic view. Deserves to be higher in ranking!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, great location, clean accommodations and free breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Tigerlilly1007
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Istanbul in May 2011. This was our first trip. There were 3 in our party and the Berce Hotel was perfect for several reasons. One, they offered a great price for a triple - double with twin. The room, located in the basement, was reasonably sized for us. Very comfortable beds and nice, updated bathroom. Two, great location in the old part of Istanbul was walking distance to many landmarks. Three, the staff was excellent. The owner was a friendly gentleman and Mehmet, our e-mail contact and concierge could not have been more helpful, courteous and knowledgeable. Breakfast on rooftop is good and varied though view is nothing to write about.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious, friendly, comfortable and delicious!”
Reviews.Author: ellenziegler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Berce Hotel in Istanbul for eight days in May 2011. I felt very at home there: everyone from the owner to the managers at the desk to the staff in the rooftop restaurant did whatever they could to make me comfortable. The rooftop views while eating delicious breakfasts are breathtaking. The rooms are tastefully decorated and very comfortable. The hotel is a short walk from the busy Sultanahmet area, but is very quiet. I can't imagine a nicer place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best choice! Don't miss it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Elton_DF
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for two nights (part of our Honeymoon trip) and decided to stay one more, reason for that: we loved Istanbul and the Hotel. Extremely friendly and helpful staff, they are always there to assist you. We felt more than welcome in our arrival and were treated like family by hotel manager Mr Mehmet. Rooms are very nice, clean and spacious, terrace view is breathtaking and hotel location is very good, short walking distance from Blue Mosque and major tourist attractions in the old center. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “feels like going home”
Reviews.Author: NNNancy
Reviews.Content: During a month of travel, I stayed at the Berca Hotel 7-8 nights. This small hotel (7 rooms) is situated on a small quiet street 10 minutes from the Blue Mosque. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Breakfast is outstanding - the view from the terrace is fabulous. Mehmet and Serkan, who work the front desk, are the reasons I'll be back. They were helpful in every way - trivial things like dry cleaning, bigger things like changing airline reservations. Whatever I needed - they found solutions - with a smile! Sunsets from the terrace are the perfect respite after a day or shopping or touring.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem!!”
Reviews.Author: fundionafrica
Reviews.Content: The joy of Tripadvisor is being to find small intimate non rated properties but still ensuring you get a 5 star experience. The Berce was just this!! Mehmet was a concierge worthy of two golden keys in any 5 star property. Nothing was too much and I really put him thru his paces, from getting a hand bag exchanged to securing Vodafone cards and laundry...all was done with a genuine smile & attention to detail. The prosition could not be faulted...it was near all the top spots, Blue Mosque, palace, bazaar etc etc all in walking distance, but off the main roads so it is quiet.

Reviews.Title: “You feel like you come home in Berce hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Isabelloveskos
Reviews.Content: The staff is very friendly and helps you where they can. They speek good english. The rooms are comfortable and clean. We stayed on the groundfloor, there you have some noice from the road, but it's not too much. Our friends stayed on the first floor and they had a nice balcony. For breakfast you can sit on the rooftop where you have a great view over the Marmara-sea. You can relax there... Breakfast is more than ok and every day we had fresh fruit with it. The hotel is near the Blue Mosque, Ayia Sofia etc..... you can al do this by feet.... and the Marmara-sea is near by..

Reviews.Title: “We returned to this hotel because we loved it in the first time, last year”
Reviews.Author: enny2410
Reviews.Content: We returned to this hotel this second time in Istambul because we already loved it when we came to Istambul for the first time last year. And it remains the same with a wonderful hospitality, location and breakfast! We felt like at home. People there are extremely helpfull and gently. The rooms are very clean and everything we need to spend a good vacation we got there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and fabulous service!!!”
Reviews.Author: satnair
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife spent about 4 nights at the Berce hotel in April for the long bank holiday weekend. The hotel is in a very quiet area. The location is excellent considering everything you would want to see and visit in the Old side of Istanbul is only about 10 minutes walk or 5 minutes by the tram ride. This was a last minute trip for us and so we couldnt plan all the places we wanted to visit and neither did we make any bookings. The best part of the hotel is the manager - Mehammet. He is an unbelievable guy. very cheerful and extremely helpful. He guided us to all the places we wanted to go and booked us in for the best rates. When we got back to the UK and went through the list of must dos in Istanbul we didnt miss any at all!! Mehemmet is a super star! I would definitely recommend this hotel. Also the hotel has only 4 - 6 rooms. So there is never a rush and every customer is treated so well. The rooms are not very spacious but they serve the purpose. Break fast in the morning was also excellent - except that they are served very early in the morning and unless you make it by then you end up getting cold food. But on the whole definitely a place to consider!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot at the best location!”
Reviews.Author: Else008
Reviews.Content: This is a much friendly and personal picturesque hotel at a great location in the historical centre of Istanbul. The hotel is family driven and offers the best of service and atmosphere - and their breakfast is just delicious. An excellent residence for your Istanbul visit.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we could have asked for & more”
Reviews.Author: RowanPiper
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for a 3 night stay in Istanbul and it fulfilled all our needs perfectly. We were so close to the attractions of the city, but the hotel is down a sweet little road as though you were staying in a village. You barely hear a sound of the city around you. The only exception being from the tannoys from the surrounding mosques at prayer times, but we found this quite relaxing! The hotel is clean, rooms are cosy and the staff are very friendly. In particular Mehmet who is extemely attentitive and genuinely seems to care about each of his guests, treating them like friends. Highly recommended and we'll be going back ourselves in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great value and location”
Reviews.Author: jphmoney99
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for three nights, and couldn't have been happier with our stay. Mehmet and his staff are incredibly professional and courteous, and the location is perfect (walking distance from all of the major sites, close to the main road so cabs can easily find it if you go out elsewhere at night). Breakfast spread (served on the roof) was the best that we had in Turkey. Pricing was great compared to similar hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience - Mehmet is a joyful host”
Reviews.Author: NickyNootheWeaste
Reviews.Content: Excellent - friendly, welcoming, quiet and comfortable - not much to add to the superlatives already written here - but they are all true. I recommend this hotel warmly.

Reviews.Title: “Under the beautiful Blue Mosque...”
Reviews.Author: lar124
Reviews.Content: Under the beautiful Blue Mosque, which you will see from this hotel's glorious rooftop terrace, is this charming boutique hotel in the Sultahnemet area of Istanbul. It is a gem-like find with clean rooms, scrumptious breakfasts where you can gaze at the Marmara and the Bosphorus, Turkish rugs in every corner and a very attentive staff. Up the winding cobblestone streets layered with eons of history, we walked all over Istanbul and always arrived back at our headquarters with friendly greetings and a quiet room. I would be back there in a heartbeat and stay at the Berce.

Reviews.Title: “Fresh, friendly, fantastic”
Reviews.Author: MsJudge
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 10 days in this quaint hotel and would recommend it to anyone. It is pretty and clean. The rooms are very comfortable. The owner and Mehmet treat you like an honored guest. They work hard to make your trip personal and memorable. The breakfasts were huge and delicious. It is walking distance to all of the great sites of Istanbul. I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: Pattyb708
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a genuine find! The Rooms are lovely, furnished with luscious towels and crisp bed linens! The hotel staff bends over backwards to accommodate your needs! The food is exceptional Turkish fare: a lovely breakfast spread of their refreshing yogurt, the best real honeycomb honey (not to be missed), various fresh fruits and juicy vegetables, cheeses olives, dried fruitsj and cereals, delightful omelets, as well as local cheese pastries, breads, good coffee and a fine selection of tea! I was room- bound due to an injury ( not related to my hotel stay) and the staff checked on me without being asked, brought ice for my ankle, brought me lunch from the dining room and were exceptionally solicitous! The hotel owner checked in with us every morning and several times guided us to our destination! Meals and cocktails are enjoyed on the rooftop terrace and deck which overlook the Bosphorous and the Marmora Sea. Ship and yacht watching is enjoyed by all. There is always hot water in the bathroom and the plumbing is reliable! The Berce is wonderfully situated on a quiet, narrow cobblestone street in Sultanamet, an easy walk to many of the tourist attractions. Because the hotel is quite small ( maybe 10 rooms) the atmosphere is exceptionally friendly and accommodating. They feel like family by the time you leave! The decor is lovely with lots of beautiful Turkish carpets everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “OUR STAY IN BERCE HOTEL WAS MEMORABLE!!”
Reviews.Author: abs1969
Reviews.Content: Mr Mehmet (the Manager) & his team were very warm and helpful . the hotel is ideally located due to its proxmity to all the important tourist destinations in Sultanamet area .

Reviews.Title: “I've been to many hotels in Istanbul, but I really enjoyed the Berce Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: babs3155
Reviews.Content: I've been to many hotels in Istanbul, but I really enjoyed the Berce Hotel. It is a fantastic hotel, The rooms are big and usually they have a balcony (also rooms with two or three balconyâ€™s) with TV, minibar and Wifi. Berce Hotel is clean and they served a wonderful breakfast on the roof, the girls make it every day fresh. In summertime the breakfast is on the roof terras. The view is fascinating, you can overview the Marmara and the bosporus with the big ships, and when the weather is good you can see the prinses islands. Also you can see the big mosques. The owners and staff are very warm and kindly, they help you in every possibly way, it can be with directing the way, or by advising what to see and how to travel. The hotel is in the characteristic Sultanameth in a piece full street, a few minutes walking from all the important buildings, such as mosques and grand bazaar. I will go there next time, i can't get a better price and quality then there. Hope I created a good picture for you and you will check it out yourself. Mrs DKH from Holland

Reviews.Title: “exactly the hotel we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: diatrani
Reviews.Content: Very good welcome. Very quiet.. Great terrace for breakfast. The room was nice but the mattress a bit hard (maybe they were new). Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended for a city trip”
Reviews.Author: glubi_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights and it was a great choice. Beside the obvious reasons - top location and good price - you should come for the staff, which is super friendly and helps you out in any instance. We liked the turkish breakfast which is served on the rooftop - they have a terrace and for the colder months a cute little breakfast room upstairs with view of the sea. It was a really lovily way to start a day. Also, while being so central, it is in a quite side street and you hear nothing besides the passing train (that one is really loud tough but it is like one per hour and stops after , say , 8 pm; so sleep was never an issue) - no street noise from cars and people, unlike many similar hotels on the quarter's central road. The receptionist was extremely nice and took his time to explain the sights and recommend tours etc. Our room was clean and also rather big. The hotel is very small and hence you get this very personalised sevice, also great for families probably.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic small family hotel - central located in Old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ThomasEmilJensen
Reviews.Content: We can recommend this small charming hotel itâ€™s a great hotel very near the main attractions in Istanbul. Two minutes walk to the Blue Mosque. Fantastic view from breakfast terrace independent of season. Large delicious breakfast buffet with homemade stuff :) Very clean and large rooms. Very friendly staff. Quite area even the railway passes close by. The tourist information and tours offered are really good deals e.g. the Turkish bath price is same as if you go by yourself but additional you get transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect welcome to Istanbul - thank you Mehmet!”
Reviews.Author: KayaR
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not reviewed in Lonely Planet, which is a shame as it is such a gem - great central location near trams and Blue Mosque, Hippodrome, etc all within easy walking distance. Rooms and bathroom were clean, comfortable and cosy - heating was important to us during Istanbul Winter - balconies with nice views of surrounding Sultanahmet. Lovely breakfast daily on the rooftop terrace. I would like to extend a warm thank you to Mehmet, the hotel concierge. He made every effort to ensure we had a wonderful stay in Istanbul and was polite, attentive, helpful and generous with his knowledge of Turkey and Istanbul, helping us better understand the culture of his wonderful country. Would recommend this hotel to anyone, especially those holidaying during Winter.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: vananenko
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in Jan, 2011. Good small inn. Room was with three balconies :), breakfast rather basic but still very good including fresh honey, located in authentic "old city" area just 5 mins walking from Blue mosque, etc and 20 mins taxi ride from airport. Breakfast on terrasse with view. No elevator however receptionist assist with luggage. Free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel! And wonderful work done by Mehmet!”
Reviews.Author: parisguy_11
Reviews.Content: This was probably one of the best hotel experiences my wife and I ever had. The hotel had a cozy and warm feeling to it, with hotel staff being particularly helpful. The rooms were spacious, and some of them had gorgeous views of the sea amidst the old city vistas. The bathrooms were clean and convenient. The breakfast was served on the top floor, overlooking half of Istanbul. The breakfast food was absolutely delicious, particularly if you like a rich selection of cheeses and fruits! On a separate note, I have nothing but praise for Mehmet, a concierge who was extremely helpful and gracious in giving advice about the city and random errands. He allowed us to use the Internet as much as we needed it, without charging a penny. A true showing of Turkish hospitality! Overall, we were very pleased and would recommend this hotel to everyone we know!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean, friendly place in the historical centre - Sultanahmet ISTANBUL”
Reviews.Author: mashasolo
Reviews.Content: Good service, clean rooms, balconies are very nice, good see view, nice breakfast on fantastic terrace, friendly and helpful staff, all of them are good english speakers . Near to all historical places of Sultanahmet. We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than expected”
Reviews.Author: EnigMavof
Reviews.Content: A perfect hotel for a very reasonable price. Only a few minutes away from the histirucal centre and still so quiet. Nice and clean room with 3 (!) balconies. Breakfast was absolutely tastfull with a lot of choice and also beautiful sea view. Most special however was the service and kindness of all staff. Very personal treatment, a great pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: mat054
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Berce hotel with my brother for 3 nights in Nov. Very friendly and helpful staff. A small, cozy and clean place with great view on the roof top for morning breakfasts. Close to many attraction sites. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel that feels a bit like home”
Reviews.Author: Delfttraveler
Reviews.Content: We had a perfect stay in Berce hotel. The friendly staff was very helpful and the room was beautiful wit sea view. Located near the historical centre it was an excellent starting point for beautiful Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “perfect place to stay and visiting Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: eefje32
Reviews.Content: I have been in Istanbul before, and this hotel I liked the best. It is a small hotel and therefore there is personal touch. Perfect location to discover the city. Breakfast was excellent with a seaview. Quiet place, but near to a mosk, so expect to hear the imam. Good value hotel, friendly and helpfull staff, clean and comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “All I expected and more”
Reviews.Author: lisk11
Reviews.Content: I had read other reviews raving about this place - and I can easily say I was still pleasantly surprised. My mum and I stayed here for 3 nights and had a wonderful experience - she is already planning her next trip back, and despite there being hotels everywhere in Sultanahmet, she will be staying at the Berce again (as will I if I return). Great service, fabulous breakfast, awesome rooms (bigger than other B&Bs I've stayed in), and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and friendly hotel, we highly recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: Ca-2010
Reviews.Content: Staying at Berce was a very good experience. First of all we were warmly welcomed by Mehmet, the friendly and kind manager, whose hospitality certainly made our trip to Istanbul even more pleasant. He was always ready to help us in whatever we needed and gave us valuable information about the city and places to be visited. The hotel is well located in the quiet old part of Istanbul, close to the main attractions (Blue Mosque, St. Sophia, Topkapi), tram lines and within walking distance of other interesting places, like the Grand Bazaar and Egyptian Market. Our room was very clean and nicely furnished, with a comfortable double bed, LCD tv set and free internet access; the bathroom was ok too. Breakfast was very good (a lot of food!) and served on the roof terrace where we have a beautiful view of the Marmara Sea, very romantic! Everything was perfect at Berce Hotel and the atmosphere so friendly that we felt like being home away from home! We would definitely stay there again and recommend it to anyone visiting Istanbul! Thank you very much, Mehmet!

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: HerbertGray
Reviews.Content: Small hotel but large room. Very quiet area but short walk to sights. Staff extremely helpful. Breakfast on roof terrace overlooking the Bosphorus.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: BarmanHelsinki
Reviews.Content: We were very to happy to get such high quality service

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, very helpful friendly people”
Reviews.Author: normanwisdom2010
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the centre of things you couldn't wish for a better hotel. Clean very comfortable, home from home. Mehmet Kaya was extremely helpful, marking on a map all the places we should see, the majority within walking distance. All the staff at the hotel were very friendly and the service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and Homely”
Reviews.Author: Family1976
Reviews.Content: The management and staff of this hotel could not do enough to make everything pleasant during our stay...right down to drinks on the terrace every evening This is a simple, clean and reasonably priced hotel and we will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Boston_Desi
Reviews.Content: We had a short stay in Berce, only one night, on the way to Antalya, but it was a wonderful introduction to Istanbul. Mehmet was tremendously helpful and charming. Our room was on the first floor and quiet as could be. The room was spacious, the bathroom clean, with plenty of hot water and the hotel was on a quiet street behind the Arasta Bazaar.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm, old city, new friends”
Reviews.Author: Dave535
Reviews.Content: group of ten friends, celebrate age (Harold's 80th) life ~ living it and remembering those no longer with us. Doing a Med cruise starting in Istanbul ~safe, clean, friendly! Boutique Hotel with 7 rooms (we had five). Right in the old city, walk to everything, the Blue Mosque as our backdrop from the rooftop terrace and breakfast room. Restaurant up the road delivered when we did not want to go out! Can not wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Berce Hotel is like being home”
Reviews.Author: teekaz
Reviews.Content: We have chosen carefully this hotel after a scrutinising reasearch among other offers, which we recommend you all. Go to specialised sites, choos type of comfort, budget you are willing to spend, location (where you want to be around of) and more important, get experience in reading reviews of clients. Some sites la booking.com scale reviews through a note system. So, all in all, having in mind all that, we were sure that we have chosen the right one. When we arrived there it was what we have expected. A quiet, clean, comfortable hotel, in Sultanahmet area, with a good choice for breakfast, people very helpful to give directions and letting you to choose, and getting on evening on the terrace to look to Bosphorus was great. The breakfast specialties cooked on the spot, we have loved them such as the tomatoes with hard cheese, fried in oil, pastry fingers with fresh cheese mix inside, etc. We have rented the basement economy room, with triple bed and we felt excellent there, at Berce hotel. Thank also to Mehmet Kaya and Serkan Kaya, people which were always at reception, to help us, even to park right the car.

Reviews.Title: “Assolutamente Consigliato - Ottimo Staff”
Reviews.Author: lloralamia
Reviews.Content: The Berce Hotel is very nice. Large clean rooms that are comfortably decorated and very pleasing to look at. Lovely rooftop terrace with delicious breakfast and views of Blue Mosque and Bosphorus Sea. Very friendly and helpful staff. Great location for walking to all the sights, shopping and restaurants. Safe and quiet neighborhood. Would highly recommend this for a small boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very positive experince.”
Reviews.Author: helen_greg
Reviews.Content: Here is our (very positive) experience with staying at Berce hotel, Istanbul. We stayed for 6 nights in the end of August, 2010. It was hot and humid, which helped us to stress-test the quality of service. The Berce hotel has passed the test with flying colors. The air-conditioner was working not-stop efficiently and quietly. Bathroom with shower (well-maintained and clean) always had hot and cold water. A small fridge kept our water cool. The breakfast was superb, worth of special paragraph. Breakfast's menu included feta, string and some other type of cheese, olives, eggs prepared in 4 different ways, yogurt, sausages, fresh vegetables and fruit, fruit preserves, freshly baked pastry with some cheese, orange juice, tea and coffee and more. In this city the food is plentiful but not particularly cheap. A cup of tea next door was 3 Turkish Lira (TL), a typical appetizer - 7 TL, a kebab - 17-25TL, a pint of beer - 7 TL. Take this into account while enjoying the breakfast included into the hotel price. Among other things worth mentioning, Wi-Fi connection was stable and strong. The large comfortable bed was convenient to rest on. Be prepared to wake up at 5 am every morning to listen to call for prayer (loud but musical). Hotel manager Mehmet was friendly and very helpful (nice-looking too). His English was perfect which helped to communicate with taxi-drivers and other hotel staff who didn't speak English. See you in Istanbul :) Helen and Greg, San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Great find, close to the major sights”
Reviews.Author: TKPup
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the highlights of a 7 week holiday around Europe and the Middle East. Great location, close to all the sights. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly, and there was no better way to start the day than the rooftop breakfast and views over the water. Would always be my first choice in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Best breakfasts and service we found in a month of touring Turkey”
Reviews.Author: Lyn2035
Reviews.Content: The women who prepare breakfast are consistently delicious cooks. The variety of their breakfasts were the morning highlight of our trip to Turkey! This tiny hotel has clean and comfortable small rooms with delightful balconies that overlooked a quiet street. It has an inviting roof top patio and the service from all the staff is excellent. We stayed for five days and plan to stay again. This location is great for families and low key travelers. We like to travel, and this hotel is great value for a smaller - or even middle-sized budget!

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: hakimjones
Reviews.Content: The Berce was by far our favorite place to stay in Istanbul. The manager, Mehmet, is very welcoming and friendly. The rooms are very comfortable, with a nice size and tastefully decorated to include all the comforts you would want. You must have the breakfast in the morning on the rooftop terrace with a view of the Bosphorous. Amazing! We hated to leave the hotel. If you're staying in the Sultanahmet area of Istanbul, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Smiles, Service, Situation”
Reviews.Author: Summers46
Reviews.Content: Mehmet, the owner of this delightful hotel, arranged for us to be met at the airport and the moment we arrived at the Berce his service and charm were very apparent. The room was superb - clean, comfortable and roomy. The situation of the hotel was a short walk from the Blue Moseque and its surrounds, many restaurants and a bazaar. Mehmet's service included arranging tours for us that picked us up at the hotel and brought us back at night. The rooftop terrace was a splendid place to have breakfast and the view was breaktaking. We are both in our 60's and this hotel gave us all the comforts of home and the convenience for sight seeing. I can not praise Mehmet and his hotel enough. Malcolm and Mary

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, immaculate hotel - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: StephanieK1982
Reviews.Content: Berce Hotel is a lovely, personal hotel just a ten minute walk away from the Blue Mosque/Agia Sofia/Topkapi. Set in a quiet side-street, it's close to plenty of local restaurants and the major tourist attractions, but doesn't suffer from the noise and overly-touristy atmosphere of other parts of Sultanahamet. With just seven rooms, you get a wonderfully personal service, with staff being warm and friendly, and offering advice on various trips, sights and local places to eat. The hotel arranged private, rather luxurious transfers to and from the airport at a very competitive price, and when I told them we were celebrating my husband's 30th birthday, they ensured we got a room with two charming mini balconies, and were also treated to a complimentary bottle of wine and grapes on our last night. Breakfast is on a roof terrace looking straight out onto the sea, and at night, the terrace boasts fantastic views of Istanbul across the Galata bridge. Our room was spacious and incredibly clean, and we didnâ€™t have to check out until 12 on the last day which was really relaxing. All rooms have air-conditioning and a very fairly-priced minibar, and drinks and service up on the terrace was available after a day exploring Istanbul. Berce Hotel offers the quality service of a luxury hotel, but with a much nicer, personal touch - they even have a dozy hotel cat. (ps: There's just one downside, but I think you'd probably get this anywhere in Istanbul. The call to prayer comes early! Pack your earplugs if you're a light sleeper.)

Reviews.Title: “nice location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: jeo58
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff. Location has more of a neighborhood feel than much of Sultan Ahmet area, but an easy walk to main sites.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a city break!”
Reviews.Author: JBristol
Reviews.Content: Simply brilliant hotel for Istanbul. Great location, very nice rooms, very helpful staff, in fact everything you need for a city stay. The hotel is small with just 7 rooms, but has everything you need. Decent sized comfortable rooms with fridge, a/c, plenty of storage and a couple of small balconies. It is situated on a quiet side street with plenty of good places to eat and drink very nearby. All the main sites are within easy walking distance and the small roof top terrace is a great way to start the day with what is, a good breakfast. The hotel staff were all very helpful and jolly and the manager was particularly good at offering advice and tips. We met the owner on our last day and even he was extremely pleasent and helpful and also anxious that we had enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Nemo1104
Reviews.Content: After months of research on hotels in Istanbul i finally narrowed it down to 2 - Hotel Sarnic and Hotel Berce. I would strongly recommend Berce for 3 reasons - great location ( a 5-7 min walk from Blue mosque), great breakfast on the rooftop terrace with a lovely view of the Bosphorus strait and nice clean cozy rooms (room 105 in which we stayed was spacious and well furnished for 2, with 3 little balconies). Overall a nice quaint little boutique hotel that offers excellent value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Warm, friendly small hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: Janice577
Reviews.Content: Genuine, homelike atmosphere with extraordinarily helpful, friendly, knowledgeable staff. Lovely roof terrace; good breakfasts; interiors not high-style but clean and decent. In wonderful quiet neighborhood within walking distance of major sights.

Reviews.Title: “An absolutely wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: turkeyl0vers
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the Berce Hotel. The rooms were comfortable and clean. The staff were friendly and very helpful. Breakfast on the roof terrace was amazing. The mini fridge just right. What a way to spend a long weekend in Istanbul. The reception staff booked us trips and a visit to the cultural centre to see the Twirling Dervish - absolutely fantastic. I couldn't recommend it highly enough. See it for yourself. Absolutely great value for money. Location perfect for all the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed hotel”
Reviews.Author: toftie
Reviews.Content: Only 7 rooms in this little hotel. Ours was a good size with no less than 3 tiny balconies giving a view of the Marmara sea, admittedly over the top of a large hoarding. The mini-bar provided a useful little fridge for our beer and water supplies. Lovely roof-top terrace with a great sea view where we had delicious breakfasts - a variety of savoury and sweet dishes such as spicy sausage omlette, cheeses, fresh water melon, etc. The reception staff speak good English and are pleasant and friendly. The location is excellent - in a quiet back street but only a few minutes walk from the Blue Mosque and other attractions. The only - very minor - drawback was that the owner prowls around the roof terace rather frequently, showing signs of control-freakery with the staff or furnishings. However he's friendly and generous with cherries.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Zmango
Reviews.Content: i have nothing bad to say about the hotel it was an amazing experience and it was a great location. It is small but the balcony breakfasts in the morning overlooking the whole of Istanbul were a prefect way to start the day. Staff were friendly and helpful and the rooms were perfect for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: murphymj
Reviews.Content: Thank you so much for making our first stay in Turkey so enjoyable. We were a group of 10 adults and everyone of us and only say "Thank you" to the staff of this gem of a hotel. We will be back again. The evenings spent on the rooftop were ones we will never forget!!!!! Thank you Mehmet for all your help to make your stay so enjoyable. The Murphy's from Canada and their friends

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with the cozy feel of a bed and breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: 2010TexasTraveller
Reviews.Content: We were very satisfied with this hotel and would highly recommend it. The room was very quaint and reminded me of a bed and breakfast. The bathroom was small, but you will be lucky to find a large bathroom in any European country. The decor of the room was fresh and relaxing, the bed was comfortable, and the air conditioning worked well. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and every morning they make fresh breakfast on the rooftop terrace. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel with wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: carolinapink
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Istanbul ealier this month at the Berce Hotel, and enjoyed one fo the best long weekends ever. The owner, his staff and everyone around were so friendly and attentive and kind to us. I would deffinitely reccomend this hotel, especially for the great views from the roof while you eat a lovely breakfast. The city is fascinating and this hotel is so near to the best bits! Thank you, Mehmet and all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: vegetarian-girl
Reviews.Content: my husband and i just returned after a 3-night stay at Berce and we had a fabulous time. Mehmet, Serkan and their support staff could not have been more welcoming and gracious. the location was superb to all the main sites, and the delicious breakfast on the terrace was the perfect start to each day. the weather was cool and sunny, and the people, helpful and friendly. we had a great time and recommend Berce highly!

Reviews.Title: “Truly a gem.”
Reviews.Author: gravcreek
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Berce for nearly three weeks in April-May. Couldn't have made a better choice. A wonderful stay in a recently renovated house in the historic district about ten minutes walk downhill from the Blue Mosque toward the Sea of Marmara. A quiet location amidst a real neighborhood. The room with shower was smallish but very comfortable and the decor attractive. The breakfasts were excellent and the views from the terrace superb. We quickly grew fond of the musical calls to prayer from the nearby mosques. Quite lovely indeed. The manager, Mehmet Kaya, was very responsive to our online inquiries before our arrival and kind and helpful throughout our stay. The other staff were exceptional as well-- Serkan, Nuray, and Hatun, were always helpful, friendly, and hard-working. The owner (whose name I missed) is a charming fellow with a good sense of humor. We are happy to have discovered the Berce. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in the main tourist district of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: rjmy2j
Reviews.Content: This was a good find in a quiet and fairly central location. The staff were helpful. Sultanahmet tram stop is about 10 mins walk uphill. The walls of the hotel room are a little thin but not too bad. In short we were happy with the overall value.

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel in historical Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Shanklin
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights - it is very clean and central to all the historical sights of Istanbul. The Manager Mehmet is very friendly and helpful and the breakfast room on the rooftop looking out over the Sea of Marmara is an absolute joy!! Only problem is the early wakeup from the call to prayer from the nearby mosques which come as a bit of a shock after very long flights. Bue hey you are in Istanbul and we soon absorbed the culture and loved it. This little hotel is a real gem and would highly recommend as value for money

Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpful staff who make your stay very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: FireflyOxford
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel..great location, fantastic breakfast each morning, clean with great staff, especially Mehmet, who couldn't do enough for us to ensure that we had a very enjoyable stay. Thank you Berce. Sue and Neil Killoran

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location - worth it, no regrets!”
Reviews.Author: MBAcapitalist
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and great value. Booked this hotel through venere.com and the reviews on there were great as well. Be sure to use a credit card that doesn't have any foreign transaction fees (tip for you US travellers). We were originally looking at the Hilton since you have a pretty idea as to what your getting yourself into when travelling in Europe/Asia. However, this hotel is in the prime spot of Istanbul, you can walk to the sites and all of the dense civilization within 10 mins. With the hilton and other major hotels, you either have to cab it, or take public transport, which is fine, but a waste of time. Also those hotels were around 30-40% higher, not worth it. Check-in was easy as "Mehmet" was quite knowledgeable about the area. He recommended a restaraunt close by and since it was pretty late, we decided to try it. Good place, but after that we ventured on our own. The hotel had complimentary breakfast which was convenient and free wireless internet in our room. We didn't utilize anything else in the hotel. The area seems very residential and quiet, but within a few blocks, your at the sites. It was also easy to get a taxi for our early morning flight (which we had to leave at 4am). Getting to the hotel from the airport wasn't that difficult either, though I recommend a taxi from SAW since the hotel shuttle takes an extra hour, and is only worth it if its just you. From IST, you can use public transport since there is a tram/train stop close by, you can also taxi from the nearest train stop as well. I stay at alot of hotels as I travel quite a bit for work, and normally get upgraded. This hotel was not bad it was actually convenient and I would definately stay there as its an excellent value and quite clean!

Reviews.Title: “If you are in Istanbul ? stay at this hotel !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: datapax
Reviews.Content: A perfect setting in the old city, excellent service to cater to your every wish. Anything you desire they accomodate. One telephone call and your meal is there in minutes, breakfast upstairs is a must, the view is spectacular. All of the staff caters to you, suites are large, pictures on site misrepresent the large size of rooms and beauty of hotel. So centrally located to everything. Simple walks to Grand Bazaar and Blue Mosque. This hotel gives you an absolute Turkish experience. A definite 5 star hotel with only 7 rooms and an excellent staff...

Reviews.Title: “Berce: great hotel”
Reviews.Author: EliandJohn
Reviews.Content: I just came back from istanbul and I stayed at berce. my stay was great and the owners of the hotel have been always there to help and assist with anything. the hotel is small (6 or 7 rooms) which makes it very cozy and typical. It is just behind the blue mosque. My room was spacious and with 2 balconies. breakfast is served on the terrace. There is also free interet access I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: MartynpaulFrance
Reviews.Content: This is a small well located hotel. The rooms are spacious and well furnished. Breakfast is on a roof terrace with a spectacular sea view. The highlight of our 5 night stay was the wonderful service we received. The staff are friendly and attentive and eager to please. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: gdina
Reviews.Content: We just loved it! Excellent location,incredible and friendly staff, comfortable and bright rooms,delicious breakfast at the rooftop terrace with very nice view.We definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “great!”
Reviews.Author: gattotapis
Reviews.Content: Excellent location: just a few steps from the Blue Mosque, St. Sophia and Topkapi. The whole staff is amazingly nice and helpful. The rooms are spacious, cleaned every day and fully furnished. The breakfast in the terrace is unforgettable. We definitely reccommend it for every kind of stay.

Reviews.Title: “a perfect little hotel”
Reviews.Author: thanjupiter
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Berce for 11 days in December 2009. This is a little hotel where everything works. The location is perfect, just steps from the Blue Mosque and the Aya Sofia. The tram line is nearby that will take you to the new city and parts of the older city and also connects with the metro and the ferries (although it is also within hiking distance). The rooms are a good size and spotless. Breakfast is very good (I miss the yoghurt) and everyone is very accomodating. Yaser, the hotel owner, was at the hotel for breakfast every morning and is also the owner of a carpet store in the nearby bazaar (I love the two carpets that I bought--they remind me of what a great and magical city Istanbul is). Mehmet at the front desk was great for providing directions to the sites and assisting with late night cabs. The real attraction of the Berce hotel is the cat in the front lobby. He epitomizes a lounge animal and sets the tone for a marvellous vacation. This is a very small hotel (only 7 rooms) so book it as soon as you confirm your trip. I believe that one of the reasons I loved Istanbul so much was because the Berce Hotel set the tone.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: Taksidiotis1
Reviews.Content: The owner of the hotel was extremely friendly and helpful in whatever we needed. The hotal itself is clean, placed in the heart of the city with marvellous view: Mosque bleu in one hand and the Bosphorus sea on the other. So so so glad we found it, best memories!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and very nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: RMaruko
Reviews.Content: The staff was extremely friendly and was keen to see that we enjoyed our stay. Breakfast at the roof terrace was very nice too. Our room was nicely decorated and spotless. Would definitely recommend this hotel to all travelers hoping to find a great value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing, welcoming, comfortable, perfect place to stay in Istanbul!!”
Reviews.Author: jdtCanda
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Berce on our return trip to Istanbul and spent our last 4 days there. We were welcomed by Mehmet on our arrival and injoyed our visits with him daily. He was very helpful and kind. Our room was more than comfortable and welcoming, we found it to be extremely clean and convenient. The roof top breakfast was delightful, we were very excited to see the filtered coffee pot!!! The view from the terrace is wonderful and we saw something new everyday. Great location, we walked everywhere, or took the tram. I would recommend anyone to stay there, look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great room and great location”
Reviews.Author: cowsyyy
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. The hotel is located no more than 10 mins walk to the Blue Mosque and Palace.
