It's about 15 mins from the Grand Bazaar (you also have the option of catching the metro which is only 1 stop). Our room was roomy and clean. It had 3 balconies and a sitting area! We received free WiFi and buffet breakfast with our room which was a plus. The service at the hotel is exceptional. Friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel for people who are looking for a nice hotel which is close to the major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: becoming138
Reviews.Content: I would encourage anyone to stay at this hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful, made us feel welcome at all hours of the day. They were always quick to assist us with making reservations for all the tours and shows. Rooms were very well done and spotless. Can't say enough good things about the place.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to stay: 12 on a scale of 1-10!”
Reviews.Author: sleepswithd0gs
Reviews.Content: From my first contact with Berce's concierge, Mehmet, I knew it would be the perfect hotel for me. Mehmet doesn't miss a detail from arranging transportation, giving me my room of choice, making one feel very comfortable in a new city, recommending sites to see, evening activities, restaurants, delivered food, out of town trips and more. On departure, he even ran down the road after my shuttle bus to return my forgotten purse! The location is perfect: very quiet, but only a short walk up the hill to all of Istanbul's main historic sites, restaurants and shopping. Walking alone day or night in this neighborhood, Sultanahmet, is completely safe. First, this hotel is a bargain! Berce is new and sparkling clean. Bathrooms are excellent with great water pressure and plenty of hot water. The Turkish breakfast is outstanding with a choice of more than twenty, fresh and healthy items: absolutely DELICIOUS! The glassed indoor and open-air outdoor breakfast area is on the top floor. The views of the Sea of Marmara and the Bosphorus, Asian Turkey, surrounding houses, the Blue Mosque and passing street vendors are splendid. It's a great place to take photos, write postcards and enjoy evening drinks. Great cooks, the kitchen staff is friendly and accommodating. From the neighboring Blue Mosque one can hear the call to prayer everywhere in the hotel: for me a delight and definite reminder one is in an "exotic" locale. Berce's charming owner Yasar Alkis, is a great friend to take shopping. Since he is a shop keeper too, he knows everyone and helped me get the best prices on many items from hats to rugs. Of course he insists you stop in when passing his shop for a glass of fabulous Turkish tea. Finally Rifki, the hotel cat (kedi) is a pretty and lively addition. I'm sure I've forgotten some detail, but for me Berce is a 12 on a scale of 1-10!

Reviews.Title: “Cool”
Reviews.Author: MherBars
Reviews.Content: Cool hotel, good place in the heart of the city! Rooms are clean, comfortable and quite. I would highly recommend everybody to stay there- it worths

Reviews.Title: “The hotel with it all!”
Reviews.Author: WovenPieces
Reviews.Content: The Berce Hotel in Istanbul is the place to stay if you're looking for comfort, friendly service, cleanliness, and reasonable prices. The rooms are comfortable and clean. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is included and it includes a variety of eggs, fruit, bread, jams, tomatoes, cheeses, etc. Because of its excellent location, you can see the sea, the Blue Mosque, and a panoramic view of the area from the rooftop breakfast area. It is within walking distance to most of the sights, as well as shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice”
Reviews.Author: bahaper
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very friendly staff, near main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and safe base for solo female traveler; great ambience & value”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoTravelergal
Reviews.Content: Stayed here nine nights and could not have asked for a more lovely "home." The rooms are spacious and well-appointed; the location is excellent and the hotel staff are gems. Manager Mehmet Kaya in particular was always helpful with information not only about Istanbul's sights but also about getting to/from. I've traveled to many countries and prefer to stay at small, more personal hotels -- this is the first that I've wanted to rave about. The hotel is even better than the posted photos!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and service”
Reviews.Author: Chissy74
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this hotel. The staff were very friendly, and very patient and understanding when our baby was sick during the night. It's a small hotel (about 8-9 rooms?) which is lovely as it feels more personal. Its location is superb. It's a very easy walk to the key attractions of Istanbul such as the Blue Mosque etc. There are plenty of cheap places to eat nearby, serving geniune Turkish food. Breakfast on the rooftop terrace is quite special as there's a lovely view of the Marmara Sea. We were very pleased to have stayed here; we loved Istanbul and staying at the Berce Hotel made it even more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for enjoying the sights and museums of Istanbul., Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: v4u474
Reviews.Content: Friendly welcome -- nice, clean rooms and good bathroom -- 24 hours security -- brilliant view from roof terrace where a good breakfast is served. About 10 minutes walk to Blue Mosque; Aya Sophia; Top Kapi; shops, bars and restaurants and a Tramway that takes you around town. Excellent hotel for enjoying the sights and museums of Istanbul. (Print a map for the taxi driver, some of those don't know the old town that well.)

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Istanbul home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Dieu_Vivant
Reviews.Content: Just seven largish rooms in this tiny hotel absolutely perfectly located between the Bosphorus and the Hippodrome. Wonderful views from the breakfast terrace, a very pleasant and helpful manager, and all the Hazun of Constantinople, as Orhan Pamuk would write..

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, small hotel in a quiet area but near all the sights of old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: fopaa
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with Hotel Berce and especially with our host, Mehmet Kaya. He stayed in email contact with us, letting us know when an additional night became available for our stay, and was very friendly and helpful during our visit. The hotel is small, located on a relatively quiet street just a few blocks from the Blue Mosque and the Arasta Bazaar. Because of the last minute availability of our first room we were given a triple located in the basement, quiet and comfortably appointed but lacking in natural light even with three small windows. The next day we moved to a lovely room complete with sitting area and 3 small balconies. It would be easy to imagine staying here comfortably for an extended stay. Mehmet told us his goal is to make the Berce feel more like home than a hotel and he has succeeded. With its great view of both the Blue Mosque and Sea of Marmara, the rooftop breakfast terrace was a beautiful way to begin the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in the old part of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: NickKhobar
Reviews.Content: I spent nine days in this wonderful small hotel within easy walking distance of the tram, Grand Bazar, Blue Mosque etc. The rooms are very comfortable, light and airy. They were very clean and the sheets and towels beautifully white and clean. The room had been very recently decorrated and furnished, with Turkish carpets covering the wood floor. The ensuite bathroom was small, modern and pleasant. Both airconditioning and central heating were available. On the top floor (up a spiral staircase) there is a pleasant breakfast terrace with both inside and outside seating and a great view of the Bosphorous. The management was very friendly, professional and helpful. Highly reccomended.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location, service”
Reviews.Author: Traveller94115
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at this hotel by myself. Given how inexpensive the hotel was, I expected it to be very basic. I was pleasantly surprised at how nicely appointed the hotel was. Nicely furnished, new appliances and furnishings, LCD tv, great breakfast, free internet, and very conveniently located. Mehmet at the front desk was incredibly helpful with calling cabs, giving directions, and generally helping out. The only thing wrong with my room was that the window didn't close properly. However, the area is so quiet that it wasn't a problem. Definitely a great place to stay!
